<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_mzq7zdssNy1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/91a6456c8fe1f4c08835ad86f6d4c2bd/tumblr_inline_mzqhq1DaTu1rr2wit.png"/></p>

<p>Ever made a wrong move with a design? Did something go terribly wrong and now you’re stuck with a crummy craft? <strong>exm</strong>'s <a href="http://bit.ly/1hc6LWW"><strong>GitCraft</strong> </a>is the answer you’ve been waiting for.</p>

<p><strong>GitCraft</strong> allows you to keep track of revisions made to your creation and can restore said revisions, should anything go wrong. The revisions are stored by Git as you save them, allowing you keep track of your history and safely allowing you to get back what you once had worked on.</p>

<p>For more info on <strong>GitCraft</strong>, click <a href="http://bit.ly/1hc6LWW"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>
As long as I don't have to commit my changes before pulling we're cool.

sounds usefull.

maybe no more versions overflow on loading window.
